intro: Pedicularis laxispica, commonly known as the lax-spurred monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that resemble those of orchids. The plant is hemiparasitic, meaning it partially relies on other plants for water and nutrients. It typically grows in rocky or forested habitats at high altitudes. Its flowers are often pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer.
